On Sun, Sep 5, 2010 at 7:19 PM, Eric J. Bowman <eric@...> wrot=
e:
> "William Martinez Pomares" wrote:
>
>>
>> It means do not force to use=
 IANA and WEB for REST.
>>
>
> Nobody ever said it did. =A0If you *are* usi=
ng the Web, then yes, REST
> *does* force you to use IANA-registered, stand=
ardized types. =A0Because
> that's the only mechanism HTTP defines, and tha=
t everybody agrees to,
> for the most important aspect of self-descriptive =
messaging -- exposing
> the processing model of the payload without having =
to introspect.

.. what?

The "most important" aspects of self-descriptive =
messaging on the web
are derived directly from the HTTP; i.e. the control d=
ata -
particularly the headers that make caching possible like Cache-Contro=
l
and Vary.

Most xhtml representations on the web are served with a *wrong=
* (not
even just opaque!) content-type, and yet that seems to have scaled o=
k.

Cheers,
Mike
